meanings.definition: A ride on a bicycle as a passenger sitting on the crossbar.
meanings.sent1: I got a croggy to school today.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the croggy through the park.
meanings.sent3: Taking a croggy feels like flying low.
meanings.sent4: The croggy was a swift journey through the neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The croggy made me feel like a bird soaring.

meanings.definition: To give someone a ride on a bicycle as a passenger sitting on the crossbar.
meanings.sent1: He croggied his friend to the store.
meanings.sent2: They often croggy each other to the beach.
meanings.sent3: Croggying someone can be a fun way to travel together.
meanings.sent4: She croggied him home before the rain started.
meanings.sent5: I will croggy you to the party later.
